comments.body: Handy suggestion: If you're going to add a picture, why not add a picture of what they would look like in game instead of the real thing? :)

I could try to, maybe I'll try sketching it then scan it to the computer Nova "inkycatz" Barlow. Thx for reading this post! Did you look at the posts I made in the structures, NPCs, Blocks/Items, Code/Commands, and Redstone sections yet?  They all have (Underground) in the title.

Yeah, just figured I'd pop in with a suggestion! We're always looking at ways we can help people improve their suggestions, and focusing less on adding real pics when an in-game picture would be so much more helpful came to mind.
Did I Actually predict the Warden and the Axolotl?

Maybe? The Warden doesn't use echolocation, but you had a pretty solid guess. You might have been a source of inspiration. When developers see ideas like that, though they likely don't directly implement them, it might get them thinking about those concepts and kind of "day dreaming" about how such things might look like in the game. What you've described is pretty different in design from the Warden, but the concept of listening for "prey" could definitely be inspiring and spark a lot of ideas, in this case how the Sculk and Warden work and appear adapted to their surroundings. It's a lot of small ideas like this that can create features :)
My idea exactly.

@WolverReigner781 We can only imagine XD XD

Z DB, your idea would be useless as soon as people realize that they can just raise sheep underground.
Did you vote? ;-)
I think your solution is a bit extreme, but making it so shulker bullets don't destroy chests would help.

I agree with clay goddess, only 10 blocks is way too extreme, I suggest maybe 30-40 would be better.

(think of how long it takes you to travel 10 blocks(3 seconds by walking and 2 seconds while running))
@ClayGoddessSari & @TheIronSniper1 I completely agree, I didn't check other mob's target radiuses so I didn't Have anithing to compare with. Will change it now
They are not too powerful but balanced really good
I have never had them shoot that far.  I just snipe them with a bow or stand under a roof.
Where did you get the idea of them destroying chests with their bullets? They can't do that.
The projectiles are meant to target the enemy and follow them until they're destroyed. That's why they're so weak.
It's suppose to be a challenge to get the shells because they are basically portable chests.
I agree with u. Squids have been in game for 13 years and their only use is dropping ink sacs. Nautiluses would be slower than squids and able to be ridden by 2 players.
Players should also be able to attach chests to nautilus.

Hello Eclyptic, I started advertising your suggestion on server I play and I gave u follow in Minecraft.
-writer of first 2 comments
Maybe other player skins, like Alex e.t.c. , and that you can summon special players ?(like with player heads)
Variation truly adds to the fun.
I would add more life to the game, not sure how hard it is to add but they have done it with plenty of mobs it would make for a great minor update.
I think variation would be a good addition to minecraft, and i think you should be able to toggle it in the settings. making some variants rarer than others would be a fun edition also.
THAT WOULD BE AWESOME! although maybe just one vote, of the four from the last two votes?
Why they get rid of tuff golemüò≠
We can't have everything we want, it's their game not ours.

I wish mobs would just come and there was no voting because this would give us a wide variety of entity's to spawn but instead we have to mod it in I disagree for this of mojangs and Microsofts choice bring all back including the upright walking pig that one made me laugh
More mythical creatures and stuff.
What I propose is to remedy what happened with the iceloger and the glow squid.
And all 3 of these mobs in each vote should be added.
How about you add them all in mojang

Not a bad idea although I think they should be more general rather than being like a shulker that stays in one specific spot attacking I think they should definitely move and spawn in plains and desert plains probably not poisonous but desert fs like spiders and cave spiders being different also they should attack chickens like wolfs attack lambs as for meat that‚Äôs good but maybe they drop scales that have some sort of bonus item maybe snake skin boots like the turtle helmet and the boots give a bonus maybe a poison effect immunity or something but yeah I like the idea

Should sink in water, like skeletons.
It is possible to occasionally appear as an enemy.
Better link: https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360047198272-Skeleton-wolves
Muy buena idea

I love the idea of a skeleton wolf (partly because I loved dantdm‚Äôs skeletal dog Grimm so much). My suggestion is that they could be found in the nether soul sand valley biome prehaps (though I think I like your lightning strike idea better)

I would love the skeletal wolf to take damage from healing potions and be healed by poison like other undead mobs. I also think that it would be cool if they behave like the skeleton horses (meaning they can both survive in sunlight and run around underwater and not drown because they don‚Äôt have lungs lol)

I also love the idea of there being a ‚Äúwither‚Äù skeleton wolf version. This version could be created by breeding two skeleton wolves at a nether fortress (making it cool, rare and something fun to collect for long term survival players like the rare blue and orange axolotl). I feel like the wither skeleton wolf should give the wither effect to anything it attacks (like how a wither skeleton does). Maybe the wither wolf could be immune to lava damage too because it‚Äôs a nether mob? Perhaps it also doesn‚Äôt take very much damage from the explosive wither skulls that the wither creates as well or have some other bonus that has something to do with the wither ie. confusing/distracting the wither for a few seconds, increasing the damage you do to any wither (or wither skeletons) you attack with it there or being immune from the wither entirely (but that might be way too overpowered).
Super
Definitely a must have for Savannahs
What does it do
Uh‚Ä¶ what‚Äôs it‚Äôs function?
Still like it though.
They're not going to have wardens drop anything aside from the current block, or they would've done so already when they released the update.
Mojang already said they don't intend on the warden dropping anything upon death besides the skulk catalyst.
Instead of dropping it, the Warden head should be part of the ancient city structure similar to the dragon head
What's the point of defeating such a powerful mob without it dropping any thing useful? This would make killing the warden a worthwhile investment.
hmm never thought of that, seems like it'd be cool
This is such a cute idea!
I also had this idea for rivers, along with a few other animals, and plants. I think otters should be tameable as well.
Support! This makes so much sense! (More sense than jungle frogs being white like desert frogs anyway)
TRUE
I hope Mojang adds these, they are my  favorite animal!
smart.
Duplicate of https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/4411233003917-Dyeing-Allays
What if you can give the allay the dye and play music, like the amethyst duplication?
The biggest issue with this is that its extremely difficult to hit a Vex with a splash potion of any kind. Might make potion effect arrows more useful though, so that'd be kinda nice.
Meh, seems out of place. Allays should turn into Vexes when struck by lightning or something.

It feels slightly off balance. Maybe the Evoker will only transform the allay if it's touching the evoker so there would be a way to block it. Vexes are too common since they can be made by evokers indefinitely so there shouldn't be a way to transform them back into allays
Maybe a golden apple, because Allays are kind of rare, but this would be difficult to do, because Vexes can literally merge with the ground and make the potion wasted.

Maybe instead of throwing a potion just give the vex the drinkable bottle form, and also maybe the evokers also target allays, and once killed by them turn into vexes. Maybe when struck by lightning they also transform but idk if lightning would be attracted to them or something cause unlike creepers you dnt really want to bolt ur allay into a vex so maybe that's just a chance thing.
Maybe all three of the guesses I think that sounds good right????
You would need three allays to create one vex.
I think that fennec foxes should just be a fox variant that spawns in the desert
Yeah
they just need a fox for the desert
A desert fox variant is a good idea. They could have burrows
Liked it, until you added the trance part. Why? What do capybaras have to do with that? Also, I don't think they should be tamed. Just fed. Also, it should be neutral mob, with 10 hearts.
I think they would be perfect to add in the new mangrove I also think the babies should ride on the parents backs kind of like striders they should also spawn in groups of 3 to 6
I need a Pomeranian in minecraft

I use a datapack that sets chickens to randomly shed feathers, which is a logical thing, chickens do shead feathers in real life. It makes for a simpler life as I don't need a lot of chicken meat but I do like to have arrows. I would love for more mobs to have such features,
This post is kinda old but parrots could molt feathers too, as well as any future bird mobs.

This would be absolutely TERRIFYING‚Ä¶ I LOVE IT!

edit: though, this has been rejected before, so maybe not

It is a massive blaze with blaze-like shields around itself. It attacks using flaming shockwaves. It will not die or get hurt in water, rain, or snow. It has a chance of dropping a blaze rod, its shield, or its helmet. While wearing the helmet, one blaze will appear, and it will follow you around and attack for you similar to a wolf. This blaze will not drop anything and it will respawn when it dies. You can dye the color of this blaze and you can name it. The blaze will vanish if you take the helmet off. If a hovering inferno is nearby while you are wearing this helmet, the blaze will turn against you. The shield will deflect arrows and set it on fire.
i think the idea of being able to tame isn't good because they aren't a pet in real life but i love the rest of the ideas but Mojang should probably use different names for the items.
glow item frames have already been added. other than that, this looks good!
the idea is good but it would not make any sense that beaver skin existed since the leather is already there.
They could also spawn around fallen trees like they felled them

I will admit that would be cool but then what would be the point of having Huskies because then you could just use wolves which can defend you and pull the sled and I also think that if you were if you were to do on land and you should then you could just add tires
Or just a variant of wolf, with the Husky-esque fur pattern.
Sounds like a good item for the leatherworker to sell.
That is silly but useful!

i wanted the same thing! so i just got a cat in my friends multiplayer world but the cats keep exploring the world and not following me. i have the feeling she will get lost. please add this mojang please. :(

This sounds like an excellent and super cool idea! I would love to have a fire-breathing pet that could sit one my shoulder and respawn. It would be interesting if when it was a baby, nether mobs would attack it like they do with turtle eggs. It would also be interesting if, like striders, they cannot touch water without being damaged. I think it would make sense that it's nest can only be placed in the nether.
it should be more a pheonix

Maybe if you break the fledgling‚Äôs ‚Äòbed‚Äô the fledgling will disappear, and if you place the bed back down the fledgling will immediately spawn again in an empty area within a few blocks of the bed (or on it). Maybe it looks similar to either a parrot, with some kind of fancy tail or head feathers, or the Ender Dragon, but much smaller?
